headline.main: VAST TRIPOLI FIRE STARTED BY R.A.F.; Bombers Also Attack Air Fields in Sicily and a Freighter at Bengazi, North Africa PANTELLERIA IS SHELLED Italians Say They Torpedoed Two Units of British Fleet on Return From Convoying

lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt, Oct. 1 -- Diving within a few feet of the target one at a time, a flight of R.A.F. heavy bombers early yesterday blasted a Tripoli truck park and started a fire so large that one British gunner described it as "like the setting sun."
abstract: RAF bombs Tripoli points, Gerbini and Comiso airdromes, Sicily and Bengazi; Brit light naval forces shell Ital E-boat base, Pantelleria; Itals rept their submarines torpedoed 2 units of Brit Fleet returning to Gibraltar from convoy duty

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

snippet: CAIRO, Egypt, Oct. 1 -- Diving within a few feet of the target one at a time, a flight of R.A.F. heavy bombers early yesterday blasted a Tripoli truck park and started a fire so large that one British gunner described it as "like the setting sun."...

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
